meanings.definition: The quality of being exotic or foreign.
meanings.sent1: The exotism of the tropical birds amazed the visitors.
meanings.sent2: She was drawn to the exotism of the vibrant cultures she encountered during her travels.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant's attempt at exotism with a fusion menu left customers puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The exotism of the ancient ruins transported her to a different time.
meanings.sent5: The exotism of the spices filled the market with an enticing aroma.

meanings.definition: The fascination with or admiration for things that are foreign or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: His exotism for Japanese art led him to collect many beautiful pieces.
meanings.sent2: The exotism of the unknown always intrigued her adventurous spirit.
meanings.sent3: Her exotism for trying new foods often resulted in interesting culinary experiences.
meanings.sent4: The exotism of the distant lands called out to her, urging her to explore.
meanings.sent5: The exotism of the foreign language made it challenging yet exciting to learn.
